options.text: "Give us a slice of the action," smiles Communist Party Chair @@RANDOM_NAME@@, placing a small iced sponge cake in front of you, and cutting @@HIM@@self the merest sliver. "We're not expecting you to end capitalism. We just want a little bit more wage equality and free market regulation." [[color=blue]Must have private industry[/color]]
options.result: @@LEADER@@ seems to wear red a lot these days

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Give us a slice of the action," smiles Capitalism Party President @@RANDOM_NAME@@, placing an enormous iced sponge cake in front of you, and cutting @@HIM@@self a decent wedge of it. "Look, we're not expecting you to end communism. We just want a little bit of opportunity for private wealth." [[color=red]Must not have private industry[/color]]
options.result: communists in @@NAME@@ note that wealth should be equal but that some should have more of that equality than others

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "All we ask is that you close the doors to those filthy immigrants!" spits @@DEMONYM_ADJECTIVE@@ Nationalist @@RANDOM_NAME@@, seemingly disgusted by the colour of the dessert in front of @@HIM@@. "They're stealing our jobs and using up our resources! Put @@NAME@@ first! Then, we'll promise to support you on every other thing." [[color=blue]Immigration is legal[/color]]
options.result: a giant 'No Entry' sign is being erected at the borders of @@NAME@@

policiesAndNotabilities.full: adds policy: No Immigration
policiesAndNotabilities.name: No Immigration

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: closed borders
policiesAndNotabilities.name: closed borders

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Why not ally with a party that has no interest in ruling?" asks Libertarian @@RANDOM_NAME@@, who has brought @@HIS@@ own strawberry cupcake, and doesn't look keen to share. "All we want is for you to shrink government a little bit, with the exception of police and military budgets. Then, we can support your new, leaner administration." [[color=purple]Must have a very large government[/color]]
options.result: the government seems embarrassed to be seen governing

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: barren, inhospitable landscape
policiesAndNotabilities.name: barren, inhospitable landscape

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: devotion to social welfare
policiesAndNotabilities.name: devotion to social welfare

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Heaven knows who is your best ally," comments @@FAITH@@ First party leader @@RANDOM_NAME@@, drawing a holy symbol on the cake's icing with @@HIS@@ finger, "and as it turns out, I've got heaven on speed-dial. Increase spending on promoting @@FAITH@@ and recognising our state religion, and you'll have our support." [[color=purple]Must have a national religion[/color] AND [color=purple]must have low religiousness[/color]]
options.result: many believe that @@LEADER@@ rules by divine right

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: irreverence towards religion
policiesAndNotabilities.name: irreverence towards religion

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "Don't deal with all these extremists!" scolds Green Party representative Hermes Deming, calculating the carbon footprint of the proffered pudding. "All we Greens want is a little more green thinking and regulation. Unlike those other lunatics, our approach will actually make you MORE popular with the mainstream." [[color=purple]Must have a very poor environment[/color]]
options.result: manufacturers are annoyed that they're not allowed to dump industrial waste into the nearest lake any more

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: barren, inhospitable landscape
policiesAndNotabilities.name: barren, inhospitable landscape

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: punitive income tax rates
policiesAndNotabilities.name: punitive income tax rates

options.text: "If you're looking for people that play well with others, then look no further," suggests Pacifist Party member @@RANDOM_NAME@@, taking the moral high ground by declining cake despite @@HIS@@ audible hunger-induced tummy rumbles. "Give peace a chance. Cut back military spending a little, disarm your WMDs and become a better person. Like me." @@HE@@ smiles at you smugly. [[color=purple]Must have WMDs and high military spending[/color]]
options.result: each infantry rifle comes pre-loaded with a single white carnation in the barrel

policiesAndNotabilities.full: adds policy: No WMDs
policiesAndNotabilities.name: No WMDs

policiesAndNotabilities.full: removes policy: Weapons of Mass Destruction
policiesAndNotabilities.name: Weapons of Mass Destruction

policiesAndNotabilities.full: removes notability: ubiquitous missile silos
policiesAndNotabilities.name: ubiquitous missile silos

options.text: "Just an observation, but if we had a more traditional first-past-the-post system then you'd have a majority government with no coalition needed," comments Party Whip @@RANDOM_NAME@@, smooshing together the remaining slices into one big slice and shoving it in @@HIS@@ mouth. "Letsh go back to that shysh-tem, and shend theshe ex-shtremists to the fringesh."
options.result: the government has declared that too much democracy gets in the way of sensible leadership

policiesAndNotabilities.full: removes policy: Proportional Representation
policiesAndNotabilities.name: Proportional Representation

options.text: "Oh... no cake left," says one of your glummest but most loyal MPs, trying to gather up some of the crumbs. "Well, I know it's a bit of a downer, but why don't we just form a minority government? We can seek support on individual bills and votes as we go. I mean, there's always someone who wants something, and if you're careful you can always cut a deal somewhere."
options.result: government ministers sport new billboards that read 'Will Trade Votes for Private Members' Bill Support'
